books.bookDescription: Lawyers from different backgrounds represent a Black man charged with killing a wealthy white couple in Virginia in 1968.
In 1965, a nursing student follows her brother to serve during the Vietnam War and returns to a divided America.

books.bookTitle: A COURT OF THORNS AND ROSES
books.bookDescription: After killing a wolf in the woods, Feyre is taken from her home and placed inside the world of the Fae.
A crime boss moves into the town where a former cop runs an inn.

books.bookTitle: A COURT OF MIST AND FURY
books.bookDescription: The second book in the Court of Thorns and Roses series. Feyre gains the powers of the High Fae and a greater evil emerges.
Justin and Emma, whose exes find soulmates after breaking up with them, have a fling on a private island on Lake Minnetonka.
Violet Sorrengail is urged by the commanding general, who also is her mother, to become a candidate for the elite dragon riders.
The second book in the Empyrean series. Violet Sorrengail’s next round of training might require her to betray the man she loves.

books.bookTitle: A COURT OF WINGS AND RUIN
books.bookDescription: The third book in the Court of Thorns and Roses series. As war approaches, Feyre endeavors to take charge of her magical and political powers.
A collection of six short stories based in New York City around the year 2000 and a novella set during the Golden Age of Hollywood.
Luzia Cotado encounters dangers when her magic draws the attention of the disgraced secretary to Spain's king.
Troubles surface when a woman looking to make a fresh start takes a job in the home of the Winchesters.
The 34th book in the Prey series. Letty and Lucas must find an expert on tropical and infectious diseases before a virus becomes weaponized.
The fifth book in the Court of Thorns and Roses series. Nesta Archeron is forced into close quarters with a warrior named Cassian.

books.bookTitle: A COURT OF FROST AND STARLIGHT
books.bookDescription: The fourth book in the Court of Thorns and Roses series. After alterations incurred by war, Winter Solstice approaches.
A trove of items collected by the Pulitzer Prize-winning historian’s late husband inspired an appraisal of central figures and pivotal moments of the 1960s.
A co-author of “The Coddling of the American Mind” looks at the mental health impacts that a phone-based life has on children.
Fox News anchors and personalities contribute to a collection of reflections on motherhood.
The Booker Prize-winning author details the attack on him at the Chautauqua Institution in 2022 and the steps he took to heal from it.
The author of “On Desperate Ground” depicts Captain James Cook’s final voyage and the controversies surrounding its legacy.
Meditations and stories about the transformational power of love by the author of “Dusk, Night, Dawn” and “Bird by Bird.”
How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
A death doula portrays some moments experienced by herself and some of her clients as they faced the end of their lives.
Carr describes the 17-year relationship he had with a Siberian Forest cat named Masha.
The actress and filmmaker describes her eating disorders and difficult relationship with her mother.
The CNN host draws out lessons for the present polarized era from the 17th-century Netherlands, the French Revolution and the Industrial Revolution.
The survivors of a shipwrecked British vessel on a secret mission during an imperial war with Spain have different accounts of events.
A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity.
The story of a murder spree in 1920s Oklahoma that targeted Osage Indians, whose lands contained oil.
The author of “Operation Paperclip” portrays possible outcomes in the minutes following a nuclear missile launch.

Violet Sorrengail is urged by the commanding general, who also is her mother, to become a candidate for the elite dragon riders.

The 34th book in the Prey series. Letty and Lucas must find an expert on tropical and infectious diseases before a virus becomes weaponized.
A reimagining of “Adventures of Huckleberry Finn” shines a different light on Mark Twain's classic, revealing new facets of the character of Jim.
A widow working the night shift at the Sowell Bay Aquarium is aided in solving a mystery by a giant Pacific octopus living there.
Secrets held by the residents of a dilapidated neighborhood come to life when a skeleton is found at the bottom of a well.
A criminal defense attorney in Biloxi becomes the prime suspect in his wife’s murder.
The fifth book in the Hawthorne and Horowitz series. In a quiet community, a new resident is found with a crossbow bolt sticking out of his chest.
A woman who works for a mysterious boss takes on a new identity to dig up information on someone.
The third book in the Crescent City series. Bryce wants to return home while Hunt is trapped in Asteri's dungeons.
After the secret of her magic to repel attacks is revealed, Freya encounters dangerous tests by the gods.

A co-author of “The Coddling of the American Mind” looks at the mental health impacts that a phone-based life has on children.

A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity.
The CNN host draws out lessons for the present polarized era from the 17th-century Netherlands, the French Revolution and the Industrial Revolution.
The MacArthur Foundation fellow and author of “Go Ahead in the Rain: Notes to A Tribe Called Quest” reflects on life and success through the lens of basketball.
The author of “Operation Paperclip” portrays possible outcomes in the minutes following a nuclear missile launch.
An examination of current struggles America faces with Russia and China.
books.bookAuthor: David E. Sanger with Mary K. Brooks

books.bookTitle: A COURT OF THORNS AND ROSES
books.bookDescription: After killing a wolf in the woods, Feyre is taken from her home and placed inside the world of the Fae.
Justin and Emma, whose exes find soulmates after breaking up with them, have a fling on a private island on Lake Minnetonka.

books.bookTitle: A COURT OF MIST AND FURY
books.bookDescription: The second book in the Court of Thorns and Roses series. Feyre gains the powers of the High Fae and a greater evil emerges.
Troubles surface when a woman looking to make a fresh start takes a job in the home of the Winchesters.
The first book in the Twisted series. Secrets emerge when Ava explores things with her brother’s best friend.

books.bookTitle: A COURT OF WINGS AND RUIN
books.bookDescription: The third book in the Court of Thorns and Roses series. As war approaches, Feyre endeavors to take charge of her magical and political powers.
Anastasia might need the help of the captain of a college hockey team to get on the Olympic figure skating team.
A math teacher at Caseham High suspects there is more going on behind a scandal involving a teacher and a student.
A former couple pretend to be together for the sake of their friends during their annual getaway in Maine.
A nurse practitioner at a maximum-security prison gave testimony against her former boyfriend that put him behind bars.

books.bookTitle: A COURT OF FROST AND STARLIGHT
books.bookDescription: The fourth book in the Court of Thorns and Roses series. After alterations incurred by war, Winter Solstice approaches.
The fifth book in the Court of Thorns and Roses series. Nesta Archeron is forced into close quarters with a warrior named Cassian.
The minivan transporting a group of friends to a luxury getaway in the woods breaks down and they get picked off one at a time.
A crime boss moves into the town where a former cop runs an inn.

books.bookTitle: THE SEVEN HUSBANDS OF EVELYN HUGO
books.bookDescription: A movie icon recounts stories of her loves and career to a struggling magazine writer.
How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
The story of a murder spree in 1920s Oklahoma that targeted Osage Indians, whose lands contained oil. The fledgling F.B.I. intervened, ineffectively.
The former first lady shares personal stories and the tools she uses to deal with difficult situations.
An examination of the cognitive skills of rethinking and unlearning that could be used to adapt to a rapidly changing world.
When we can and cannot trust our intuitions in making business and personal decisions.
A botanist and member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation espouses having an understanding and appreciation of plants and animals.
The story of the American rowers who pursued gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympic Games; the basis of the film.
The Pulitzer Prize-winning author of “Evicted” examines the ways in which affluent Americans keep poor people poor.
An account of the American Eighth Air Force in World War II; the basis of the TV series.
More than 365 images and reflections by the National Book Award–winning author and Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inductee.
The filmmaker shares his love of cinema with special attention given to key American films of the 1970s.
The British journalist shares stories and observations; the basis of the TV series.
The late feminist icon explores the causes of a polarized society and the meaning of love.

books.bookTitle: THE HUNDRED YEARS' WAR ON PALESTINE
books.bookDescription: An account of the history of settler colonialism and resistance, based on untapped archival materials and reports.
Famous examples of miscommunication serve as the backdrop to explain potential conflicts and misunderstandings.

books.bookTitle: THE BOY, THE MOLE, THE FOX AND THE HORSE

books.bookDescription: A boy with a facial deformity starts school. (Ages 8 to 12)
The friends Frank and Stanley give a vivid account of the Pearl Harbor attack. (Ages 8 to 12)
After a shark attack, Odder recuperates at the aquarium with the scientists who raised her. (Ages 8 to 12)
The demigods Will and Nico embark on a dangerous journey to the Underworld to rescue an old friend. (Ages 10 to 14)

books.bookTitle: WINGS OF FIRE: A GUIDE TO THE DRAGON WORLD
books.bookDescription: A deeper dive into the legends of the 10 dragon tribes. (Ages 8 to 12)
During the summer before fifth grade, 10 year-old Ferris contends with friends’ and family’s bouts with love. (Ages 8 to 12)
A dog who serves as the eyes for three bison in a park enclosure devises a plan to free them. (Ages 8 to 12)

books.bookTitle: THE COMPLETE COOKBOOK FOR YOUNG CHEFS
books.bookDescription: Over 100 kid-tested recipes from America's Test Kitchen. (Ages 8 and up)
Three children in three different conflicts look for safe haven. (Ages 9 to 12)
The coming-of-age story of a young colt named Sky. (Ages 8 to 12)

books.bookTitle: WHAT DO YOU DO WITH AN IDEA?
books.bookDescription: Giving a new idea the room to grow. (Ages 5 to 8)

books.bookTitle: THE WONDERFUL THINGS YOU WILL BE
books.bookDescription: A celebration of future possibilities. (Ages 3 to 7)
Bingo wants to do a big girl sleep and wake up in her own bed. (Ages 4 to 8)
What to serve your dragon-guests. (Ages 3 to 5)
The actor George Takei tells the story of his family’s incarceration in Japanese internment camps during World War II. (Ages 6 to 9)

books.bookTitle: I LOVE MOM WITH THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
books.bookDescription: That ravenous insect is brimming with motherly love. (Ages 3 to 5)
Silly songs and sound effects. (Ages 4 to 8)
The Big Cheese learns a lesson in humility. (Ages 4 to 8)
Problems arise when Duncan’s crayons revolt. (Ages 3 to 7)
Cookie builds up her self-confidence. (Ages 4 to 8)
In Ireland, friends at the private school Tommen College prepare for adulthood. (Ages 16 to 18)
The story of Evangeline Fox, Jacks, the Prince of Hearts and the pursuit of true love. (Ages 13 to 18)
The travails and challenges of adolescence. (Ages 9 to 12)

books.bookTitle: A GOOD GIRL'S GUIDE TO MURDER
books.bookDescription: Pippa Fitz-Amobi solves murderous crimes. (Ages 14 and up)
Biographies unlock legendary lives. (Ages 8 to 11)
books.bookAuthor: Jim Gigliotti and others; various illustrators

books.bookDescription: A boy battles mythological monsters. (Ages 9 to 12)
In a dystopia, a girl fights for survival on live TV. (Ages 12 and up)
A wizard hones his conjuring skills in the service of fighting evil. (Ages 10 and up)
Roz the robot adapts to her surroundings on a remote, wild island. (Ages 7 to 12)

books.bookTitle: THE SUMMER I TURNED PRETTY TRILOGY
books.bookDescription: A beach house, summer love and enduring friendships. (Ages 12 and up)
Forbidden love is in the air when Paedyn, an Ordinary, and Kai, an Elite, become romantically involved. (Ages 14 and up)
Annabel Price's mother was presumed dead, until she reappears during the filming of a documentary about her disappearance. (Ages 14 to 17)
Two young rival journalists find love through a magical connection. (Ages 13 to 18)
In the sequel to "Divine Rivals," Roman and Iris will risk their hearts and futures to change the tides of the war. (Ages 13 to 18)
After a portal spell goes awry, five teenage wizards are stranded in the wilderness. (Ages 14 and up)
An imprisoned Prince Oak must decide between his love and his kingdom. (Ages 14 to 18)
In this sequel to "Lightlark," Isla must chose between her two powerful lovers. (Ages 13 and up)
Murtagh and his dragon, Thorn, must find and outwit a mysterious witch. (Ages 12 to 15)
Rune, a witch, and Gideon, a witch-hunter, fall in love. (Ages 13 to 18)
Wyatt Westlock inherits her family's farmhouse and intends to burn it to the ground until she finds Peter, an immortal, chained in the basement. (Ages 13 to 18)
In 1965, a nursing student follows her brother to serve during the Vietnam War and returns to a divided America. Read by Julia Whelan. 14 hours, 57 minutes unabridged.
The 1965 science fiction novel that is the basis of several adaptations. Read by Scott Brick, Orlagh Cassidy, Euan Morton, Simon Vance and Ilyana Kadushin. 21 hours, 2 minutes unabridged.
A woman who works for a mysterious boss takes on a new identity to dig up information on someone. Read by Saskia Maarleveld. 9 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.

The second book in the Empyrean series. Violet Sorrengail’s next round of training might require her to betray the man she loves. Read by Rebecca Soler and Teddy Hamilton. 28 hours, 16 minutes unabridged.

Violet Sorrengail is urged by the commanding general, who also is her mother, to become a candidate for the elite dragon riders. Read by Rebecca Soler and Teddy Hamilton. 20 hours, 47 minutes unabridged.
A math teacher at Caseham High suspects there is more going on behind a scandal involving a teacher and a student. Read by Leslie Howard and Danny Montooth. 9 hours and 35 minutes unabridged.
The fifth book in A Court of Thorns and Roses series. Nesta Archeron is forced into close quarters with a warrior named Cassian. Read by Stina Nielsen. 26 hours, 5 minutes unabridged.
Secrets held by the residents of a dilapidated neighborhood come to life when a skeleton is found at the bottom of a well. Read by Dominic Hoffman. 12 hours, 22 minutes unabridged.

Different groups form to help or fight a crumbling alien civilization coming to invade Earth; the basis of the streaming series. Translated by Ken Liu. Read by Luke Daniels. 13 hours, 26 minutes unabridged.
A true crime podcast focusing on the unsolved murder of her friend forces Lucy to return to where it happened. Read by Will Damron and January LaVoy. 9 hours, 18 minutes unabridged.
The third book in the Crescent City series. Bryce wants to return home while Hunt is trapped in Asteri's dungeons. Read by Elizabeth Evans. 29 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
The life that a Chicago P.D. retiree has built in Ireland with a local woman and her daughter comes under threat. Read by Roger Clark. 16 hours, 25 minutes unabridged.

A widow working the night shift at the Sowell Bay Aquarium is aided in solving a mystery by a giant Pacific octopus living there. Read by Marin Ireland and Michael Urie. 11 hours, 16 minutes unabridged.
Passion arises between Bryce Quinlan and Hunt Athalar as they seek to avenge the deaths of Bryce’s friends. Read by Elizabeth Evans. 27 hours, 50 minutes unabridged

After meeting a woman who shares the same birthday, Alix Summer becomes the subject of her own true crime podcast. Read by Kristin Atherton, Ayesha Antoine, Louise Brealey et al. 10 hours, 13 minutes unabridged.
The actress and filmmaker describes her eating disorders and difficult relationship with her mother. Read by the author. 6 hours, 25 minutes unabridged.
A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity. Read by Peter Attia. 17 hours, 8 minutes unabridged.
Shrier makes her case that the mental health industry has a negative impact on American children. Read by the author. 8 hours, 57 minutes unabridged.
The tech journalist and podcast host gives an overview of the tech industry and the foibles of its founders. Read by the author. 7 hours, 40 minutes unabridged.
The multiple Emmy Award-winning producer of “RuPaul’s Drag Race” traces his journey from his childhood in San Diego to becoming a pop culture icon. Read by the author. 7 hours, 7 minutes unabridged.
How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery. Read by Sean Pratt. 16 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over 35 years. Read by the author. 6 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
A co-author of “The Coddling of the American Mind” looks at the mental health impacts that a phone-based life has on children. Read by Sean Pratt and the author. 10 hours, 33 minutes unabridged.
How Homo sapiens became Earth’s dominant species. Read by Derek Perkins. 15 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.

The author of “The Code Breaker” traces Musk’s life and summarizes his work on electric vehicles, private space exploration and artificial intelligence. Read by Jeremy Bobb. 20 hours, 27 minutes unabridged.

The Grammy Award-winning pop star details her personal and professional experiences, including the years she spent under a conservatorship overseen by her father. Read by Michelle Williams. 5 hours, 31 minutes unabridged.
Applying the principles of Navy SEALs leadership training to any organization. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.

The story of a murder spree in 1920s Oklahoma that targeted Osage Indians, whose lands contained oil. The fledgling F.B.I. intervened, ineffectively. Read by Will Patton, Ann Marie Lee and Danny Campbell. 9 hours, 45 minutes unabridged.
The Duke of Sussex details his struggles with the royal family, loss of his mother, service in the British Army and marriage to Meghan Markle. Read by the author. 15 hours, 39 minutes unabridged.
The author of “Red-Handed” depicts a scheme involving the Chinese Communist Party’s covert operations in America. Read by Charles Constant. 7 hours, 43 minutes unabridged.

books.bookTitle: I WILL TEACH YOU TO BE RICH, SECOND EDITION

books.bookDescription: The 12th book in the Dog Man series. Dog Man finds himself back on his hind legs after being sprayed by a skunk.
The fifth book in the Cat Kid Comic Club series. As publication seems possible, the baby frogs feel doubt.
The seventh book in the Wings of Fire graphic novel series. Winter must face his family in the Ice Kingdom.

books.bookTitle: TWENTY THOUSAND FLEAS UNDER THE SEA
books.bookDescription: The 11th book in the Dog Man series. Piggy returns and the Supa Buddies are sabotaged.
The 15th book in the Baby-Sitters Club graphic novel series. Things escalate when a practical joker causes Claudia to break her leg.
The ninth book in the Amulet series. A threat of darkness tests new friends and old foes.
A group of activists seeking to free their political allies befuddle a class field trip to a museum.
While it seems as if nothing can stop Tomura, Midoriya returns ready to fight.
The 14th book in the Baby-Sitters Club graphic novel series. Members of the club have different reactions to visiting New York City.
The 30th book in the Big Nate series. Nate defends his status as the owner of the filthiest locker at P.S. 38.
Monkey D. Luffy and his Straw Hat crew encounter new Emperors of the Sea.
The ninth book in the Dog Man series. After turning in his badge, the canine cop is determined not to just roll over.
The seventh book in the Dog Man series. A new villain has a bone to pick with Dog Man while Petey the Cat starts a new life.

books.bookTitle: FIVE NIGHTS AT FREDDY'S: FAZBEAR FRIGHTS, COLLECTION, VOL. 4
books.bookDescription: Three stories adapted into a graphic novel by Christopher Hastings.
books.bookAuthor: Scott Cawthon, Elley Cooper and Andrea Waggener.

books.bookDescription: Charlie wants to take his relationship with Nick, who will go to university next year, to a new level.
Musicians from different backgrounds are attracted to each other and a mother flees with her son from an abusive husband.
When aircraft from rival nations have a midair collision and the Campus is attacked, Jack Ryan Jr. tries to avert a war.
An unmarried wedding planner contends with problems, secrets and scandals.
Jess has suspicions about her half-brother’s eclectic and unfriendly neighbors when he goes missing.
The 32nd book in the Prey series. Virgil Flowers and Lucas Davenport go after a group of vigilante killers.
The third book in the Archer series. Archer, Dash and Callahan search for a missing screenwriter who had a dead body turn up in her home.
Lamont Cranston puts together a team to stop a killer bent on changing the world order.
Two romance stories: “Irish Rose” and “Skin Deep.”
A jailbreak, a pair of murders and the kidnapping of a marshal’s daughter force Charlie Tuttle, a former Texas Ranger, to come out of retirement.
books.bookAuthor: William W. Johnstone and J.A. Johnstone

books.bookDescription: Two thrillers: “Tears of Pride” and “Devil’s Gambit.”
A divorced mother of twins and chief executive of a luxury department store in New York City goes against a wealthy investor looking to take over her business.
Two romance stories: “The Heart of Devin MacKade” and “The Fall of Shane MacKade.”
Two childhood friends follow in their fathers’ footsteps, which puts them on opposite sides of the law.
Sarah McAdams returns to her childhood home to make a fresh start with her daughters. But dark memories and a new menace lurk.
The 15th book in the Leopard series. Animal instincts bring two shifters closer together.

books.bookTitle: MATT SPROUTS AND THE CURSE OF THE TEN BROKEN TOES
THE SWIFTS: A DICTIONARY OF SCOUNDRELS
IF ONLY I HAD TOLD HER
IF HE HAD BEEN WITH ME

reading-clubs.name: Mystery Enthusiasts
reading-clubs.description: Join fellow sleuths to dive into classic and modern mystery novels. Perfect for those who love solving puzzles and uncovering secrets.

reading-clubs.name: Sci-Fi Lovers
reading-clubs.description: Explore futuristic worlds and scientific wonders with our Sci-Fi Lovers club. Ideal for fans of space adventures and imaginative technology.

reading-clubs.name: Romance Readers
reading-clubs.description: Dive into tales of love and passion with the Romance Readers club. Perfect for those who enjoy heartfelt stories and happy endings.

reading-clubs.name: History Buffs
reading-clubs.description: Travel back in time with the History Buffs club. Discuss historical events and figures while reading captivating history books.

reading-clubs.name: Fantasy Fans
reading-clubs.description: Embark on magical adventures with the Fantasy Fans club. Ideal for those who love mythical creatures and epic quests.

reading-clubs.name: Non-Fiction Nerds
reading-clubs.description: Expand your knowledge with the Non-Fiction Nerds club. Perfect for readers who enjoy learning about real-world topics and insights.

reading-clubs.name: Thriller Seekers
reading-clubs.description: Experience heart-pounding suspense with the Thriller Seekers club. Ideal for fans of fast-paced plots and unexpected twists.

reading-clubs.name: Adventure Readers
reading-clubs.description: Join the Adventure Readers club for thrilling expeditions and daring escapades. Perfect for those who love action-packed stories.

reading-clubs.name: Biographies and Memoirs
reading-clubs.description: Delve into inspiring life stories with the Biographies and Memoirs club. Ideal for readers who enjoy personal journeys and real-life experiences.

users.description: I'm a book lover who enjoys reading a wide variety of genres. I'm always looking for new recommendations and love discussing books with fellow readers.
